title: The Chauffeur's Distress
atmosphere: Desperate urgency. A voice on the radio, clearly in distress. The moral weight of a difficult choice.
description: A distress call comes from the Dictator's Vargr chauffeur. She's been injured trying to reach her elderly parents. This is the adventure's moral crucible.
objectives: Receive and assess the distress call
Weigh the rescue against other priorities
Make a decision that will define the Travellers

triggers.entry: Crisis ongoing, radio contact with chauffeur

the_situation.chauffeur_status: Injured - blinded by windshield glass when vehicle crashed
the_situation.parents_status: Elderly Vargr couple, stranded near eruption zone
the_situation.location: Accessible but dangerous route from Travellers' position
the_situation.competing_priority: Masterton has directed resources to Barvinn (11 refugees)

moral_weight.species: Will saving Vargr matter less to some?
moral_weight.heroism: This is what heroes do - the hard thing

rescue_attempted.success: Chauffeur and parents saved. Deep gratitude. Local reputation enhanced.
rescue_attempted.failure: Brave attempt recognized even if unsuccessful.

rescue_declined.justification: Resources needed elsewhere. Defensible but cold.

narrator_prompt: Her voice comes through the static - the Dictator's chauffeur, the Vargr everyone says is 'one of the good ones.' She's blind now, glass in her eyes, and she's crying not for herself but for her parents, trapped and waiting for help that isn't coming. Masterton has sent the resources to Barvinn - eleven people there. Here, it's just three Vargr. What will you do? What kind of people are you?
